availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Washington Brand (Lexington, Kentucky, grocer and bank director)

body.p: Lexington, Kentucky, grocer and bank director. Kentucky native. Father of Lilly Brand, John H. Brand, Nannie Brand, Harriett Brand, and Fannie H. Brand. Grocer in Lexington in 1860. Director of the Lexington Branch of the Bank of Kentucky in 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, District 2, p. 203; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 3, p. 146; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fayette County, Lexington, Ward 3, p. 85; George W. Ranck, History of Lexington, Kentucky, Including Biographical Sketches and Personal Reminiscences of the Pioneer Settlers, Notices of Prominent Citizens, Etc., Etc. (Cincinnati, OH: Robert Clarke and Company, 1872), p. 328; Find A Grave, "George Washington Brand (1812-1883)," Memorial #98132209, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=98132209 (accessed August 24, 2017).
